result.execSummary:
The defendant James P Eaton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Firearm warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored.

Court Reporter: Jennifer Schmaling. Defendant James P Eaton in court with attorneys Katie Lynn Gutowski & Margaret Johnson.  Defendant James P Eaton in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State indicates Chapter 950 compliance.  Amended Information filed.
Defense - COP filed yesterday.
State made a statement as to amended information being filed.  Will recommend prison and stand silent as to amount of time, count 2 DRI.  Discussed the matter with victim's family.
Defense indicates any indication of intentional homicide be removed.
Defendant indicates he has been informed of his rights in this matter and had the opportunity to discuss the matter with his attorney.
Rights given to the defendant.
Defense attorneys questionned. 

Defendant pleads No Contest to amended count 1, First Degree Reckless Homicide, PTAC.  

BTC:  Found Guilty of amended Count 1.  Count 2 DRI.

Court Reporter: Jennifer Schmaling. Defendant James P Eaton in court with attys Katie Lynn Gutowski and Margaret Johnson.  Defendant James P Eaton in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Denny hearing.

Court indicates he has reviewed the DVD of interview of MIchael Davis.  DVD marked as Exhibit 1.  

Atty Johnson went through the Denny criteria; motive that third person committed the offense.
Exhibit 2 - Police report of 7-2-98 of interview of MIchael Davis.

Atty Repischak questions the conditions around the DNA sample that links a third party.

BTC:  3 prongs of motive, opportunity and direct connection sufficiently met.  Third person evidence to be permitted, however, no mention to be made of victim's cocaine use.  Defense to prepare the order.

Court Reporter: Jennifer Schmaling. Defendant James P Eaton in court with attorney Katie Lynn Gutowski.  Defendant James P Eaton in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  On state's request for adjournment of trial.

Per Atty Repischak, he just received the file which consists of 14 binders full of information.  He has gone thru a couple and now feels he will have to amend his witness list.  He also went to the crime lab to go through the reports with the analysists and they had reports that had not yet been turned over to the state.  Yesterday he received discs from the crime lab marked discovery/additional.  He feels it will take him a couple of weeks to to review and requests that the trial be adjourned to late 2016 or early 2017.

Per Atty Gutkowski, they object to the trial being adjourned.  They would request that the state be excluded from using any new information.  There is the possibility of a speedy trial demand.  She would like to review the additional information from the Crime Lab.  

BTC:  A request to bar testimony is inappropriate.  Adjournment granted but NO FURTHER ADJOURNMENTS OR DELAYS.  Jury questionnaire to be finalized by 10-28-16.  
Disclosure of new court reporter made and arrangements for this trial - no objection by the state or defense.
Denny hearing remains for 9-22; new pre-trial date arranged.  Jury trial scheduled for November 28, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 21, 2016 at 02:30 pm.
From ADA Repischak requesting adjournment
to allow evidence of motive and opportunity of a third party to commit the offense pursuant to State v. Denny

Defendant James P Eaton in court with attorney Katie Lynn Gutowski.  Defendant James P Eaton in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer. TRANSCRIPT FILED 06-03-2015/tk
The Court marks Ex #3, copy of miranda rights card as used by the officer and provided by the State, on its own. The defense indicates they agree that this is a true copy of the same card used and request no additional evidentiary hearing regarding same.

Mr. Chiapete indicates that photo's of the initial arrest and search warrant have been turned over. Photo's of fingerprints have been provided to Ms. Gutowski. There were requests regarding bite marks and Inv. Knaus has been in contact with ME's office and that discovery does not exist. Parties are prepared to schedule this matter for trial The State indicates this trial should last a week and a half. State is asking for trial in November

BTC: Suppression of statements given by defendant April 5, 2014 is denied. All portions not previously suppressed by this court may be used.
         Suppression of statements given by defendant April 6, 2014 is denied.
          The State is to prepare an order in conformity with this Court's decision.

Defendant James P Eaton in court with attorney Katie Lynn Gutowski and Margaret Johnson.  Defendant James P Eaton in custody.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The decision regarding to suppression is stil outstanding and the Court is aware. The defense has indicated they submitted another list to Mr. Chiapete as to what they are still missing. Parties are not quite sure what does and does not exist anymore. Defense is also still waiting for photographs taking during search warrant. Mr. Repischak indictates that he was informed by Mr. Chiapete that defense can deal directly with Inv. Knaus if they are still missing discovery.

BTC: Defense is to prepare a specific order for the Court to sign regarding particular discovery. The Court would like to see a copy of the card used for Miranda/Goodchild warnings as referenced by Inv. Knaus at 3/27 motion hearing.  Status conference scheduled for May 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Status conference on April 2, 2015 at 11:00 am.

Defendant James P Eaton in court with attorney Katie Lynn Gutowski and Margaret Johnson.  Defendant James P Eaton in custody.  W Richard Chiapete appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Jane Slaght. TRANSCRIPT FILED 03-11-2015/tk
The Court indicates they could not view one of the CD's. The Court advises counsel that in matters as serious as this, the Court requires a transcript of the information the Court is to review.

The State does not contest this was a custodial interrogation and therefore stipulate that Miranda was necessary. Witnesses are ordered sequestered. The State calls Inv. Thomas Knaus - DSAT. Direct by the State.  Cross xam by Ms. Gutowski for the defense. State calls Detective Phillip  - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross by Ms. Gutowski for the defense. The State calls Inv. Keith Dobesh - DSAT. Direct by the State. Cross xam by Ms. Gutowski for the defense. Defense marks Ex #1-DVD interview of4/5 and Ex #2-DVD-interview of 4/6. Parties stipulate that these DVD's are true and accurate representations of the interviews with the defendant and will have a transcript made of the interviews for the Court. Defense moves Ex #1 & 2 into evidence. Exhibits are received. No further witnesses for the State. Defense has no further evidence to present. 

Defense notes that their discovery demand has not yet been complied with and as of today a list of the information that the defense expert needs has been provided to the State.

BTC: The Court needs to review the transcript as they could not open both DVD's. The State is to advise the defense by next Wednesday, a timeline of when the State expects to have the information. State to do a letter outlining all information.  Status conference scheduled for April 2, 2015 at 11:00 am.
